Manager , Alberto provided customer service to a high level I have never experienced (and I have travelled all around the world) and went above and beyond to make our stay welcome and comfortable. (Thanks Alberto ) Grace , John and Nelson also, however all staff had a friendly smile and the lobby was filled with great conversation and morale. The hotel also has a terrace which is open for all guests which is located on the rooftop bar with a view of the Empire State and they make yummy coffee in the lobby. Would definitely recommend , this is the best accomodation I have stayed in Manhattan and will endeavour to return upon my next visit to Manhattan from Australia. Have an incredible summer team Moore.

title: Wait for a change of manager to go
text:
This hotel has beautiful rooms, even if very small and the location in Manhattan is great. It is quiet from the outside,
Besides that, avoid it as there is no service. The staff is totally inefficient except the cleaning team who is always nice. 
I didn’t get the room I have paid for… the bed was very small and it was ok because I was alone
They let my friend who came to join me wait more than 30minutes, telling her they were not allowed to give my room number, but they didn’t contact me either 
No breakfast, no kettle, no fridge.. just the minimum… 
They can’t even help you to find a taxi when you have to go to the airport 
Other small detail : why is there hangers into the shower??
Change the manager and it might become a nice hotel

title: Lovely stay
text: Lovely staff, decor, and location. Every staff member was warm and helpful. Lovely location at the corner of a residential and lively street. Lots of delightful places to eat nearby. The hotel has a bar and coffee shop that came in handy many times.

title: Little Gem
text: Truly an extraordinary place! The newly renovated rooms are quiet and comfortable and really beautifully decorated, as is the lobby. The staff is accommodating and really give off a vibe that they like what they do, something not found so often in the hospitality industry. I'll be back.

title: Lovely, quiet, small hotel in Charming Neighborhood
text: My family gathered in NYC last weekend, and we all stayed at the Moore. The hotel was perfect for us. Our room was small but well thought-out, with a place for everything. The bed was super comfortable, and the room was quiet, so we slept well. We gathered on comfy couches or around the table in the lobby each morning and planned our day over delicious espresso drinks and pastries. It was a quick and easy train ride to Broadway shows near Times Square, and a short walk to Chelsea Market, and the Highline. There are lots of good restaurants near the hotel.  We'll definitely be back!

title: My always go-to
text: I’ve had the pleasure of staying at the Moore hotel several times. From their opening in late September until now, I have stayed with them nearly once a month for a week on business. The rooms are clean and chic. As a previous NYer I rarely trust most places, but here feels like home. Alfredo makes the best coffee in the morning and is incredibly kind. Perks are the following, clean and aesthetically pleasing, perfect location for getting around the city easily, catered to you and your stay while you’re there!

title: Lovely hotel
text: My husband and I only had the opportunity of spending one night at this hotel. Wish we could have stayed longer. It’s just perfect. Great location, clean and modern room, friendly staff. Ideal for anyone!!

title: Great find!
text: Beautiful, newly renovated hotel in convenient location with wine and espresso bar in lobby. Room is small, but well-designed and appointed. Bathroom and shower are great! Staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Loved it.

title: Beautiful hotel, perfect location
text: My husband and I stayed at the Moore for 9 days and had the best time -- the staff is gracious, friendly and helpful; the decor is gorgeous and tasteful; the cafe and room service offerings are well- executed; and the location is perfect for getting to all of our favorite spots. 10/10 would recommend and would stay here again.

title: A Chic Gem in Chelsea
text: The staff was so gracious and friendly. Shout out to John and Alfredo! The lobby is lovely - very simple and chic with a charming cafe for coffee, pastries, and wine. While our room was NYC-small, it was very well designed with a lovely bathroom and excellent shower. And although it was chilly, we wandered up to the rooftop deck to check out the view. It must be a fantastic spot during warmer months. The location is great as we were close to the subway, walking distance to the High Line, the West Village, and the Whitney. We will return! Loved it.

title: Quaint, clean and cozy
text:
Super quant spot.  Customer service by staff was above most places I’ve stayed in NYC. Very friendly!  
The rooms were thoroughly cleaned daily as well as in the hallways. 
The cafe was perfect for a jumpstart in the morning. 
The reason for a minus one star is that the rooms are really small even by NYC standards, and the room lighting very dim.  Almost impossible to see in the bathroom. But overall well appointed and comfortable!!!

title: Excellent Spot in the Heart of Chelsea
text: Perfect spot in a great location, with great 24/7 coffee bar in the lobby, Forager's Table attached to the building, great food service with The Butler and very friendly, accommodating staff. I'd stay here again.

title: Suggested Hotel, close to everything
text:
The staff was amazing, always ready to help me in everything.
The room, a queen interior, was really quiet, clean and confortable, maybe Just a little bit narrow, but for One people It was perfect.
The position Is really good: close to the underground and a lot of services. In 30 minutes you can easily reach everything in the city.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: The staff and especially Cristina were welcoming and helpful. Cristina went above and beyond making us feel at home. She also makes the best coffee accompanied by the most charming conversation. Beautiful rooftop terrace with exquisite views. A compact but beautifully appointed room, along with excellent service crew, made for a wonderful experience.

title: Room with a view
text:
If you are visiting NYC and plan to spend most of your time exploring, eating out, and taking in all the amazing things the city has to offer, The Moore is an ideal nest to settle into.  Chelsea is a great neighborhood, and the Moore is located on a classic, tree-lined side street.  Super close to the Highline and the subway.

Friendly staff that were welcoming and warm.  Young and hip atmosphere, with a stylish and small lobby, serving coffee and wine. My room had a view of the Empire State Building.  Small and cozy, it was plenty of space for one.  But, with a sliding door to the bathroom at the foot of the bed, it would be a little too intimate for two.

LGBTQ friendly.  

Verdict: Highly recommended for solo travelers looking for a good value in a stylish, boutique hotel.  The suite would be a great choice for couples or those able to spend a little more for more space, a balcony, and bigger views.

title: Great location but very noisy
text:
Pros:
Location is perfect
Rooms are clean
Shower was great
Loved the Replica shampoo/conditioner/lotion

Cons
Rooms are very cute but very small even for NYC (felt a bit claustrophobic)
Slamming of doors (impossible to sleep as you can hear every door close all night long)
Bed was not comfortable 

I don't think I would stay again just because of the slamming doors. I didn't sleep for two nights and I'm not a light sleeper. People are coming in and out all night and every time they close their door it can wake the dead!

title: A little gem in Chelsea
text: What a great find the Moore is. Chic, quiet and friendly, I’ll definitely be coming back. Such great value for money but elegant at the same time. Very clean, rooms are cute and beds very comfy. Thank to all the reception staff who made us feel so welcome. Highly recommend ❤️

title: Very (very) friendly place to stay in NY
text: From the front desk service and care, the relaxing lobby with the excelent coffee, through the friendly, intelegent and charming hosts (don't miss lovely Christina!!) to the quite, high-end design, very clean and modern rooms, with it's best location (close to every thing but far away from the crowd spots

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Wonderful experience at The Moore.  The service was en par to the Four Seasons but in a neighborhood setting.  Everyone was so attentive and helpful.  The young man at the front desk even flagged down a cab for me and loaded my luggage!  The rooms are small but the design is genius!  Every inch of space so intelligently used.  Great location!  Twenty minute walk to Hudson Yards and the Vessel, the Highline, Madison Square Garden, Times Square, SoHo NoHo, the Village.  Bunch of restaurants and grocery stores on the same block.  Subway couple blocks away.

title: New, Hip and Infectious
text: This brand new hotel is in a great location in Chelsea, has very comfortable beds and a lovely rooftop space. However we were quite disturbed at the lack of mask-wearing by almost all of the front desk and cafe staff. This clearly encouraged a good number of hotel guests to also ignore the NYC masked mandate in indoor spaces .We don't consider ourselves particularly anxious about COVID, however in these times of Delta variant, we felt uncomfortable and exposed.

title: will recommend
text: Super amazing staff, they went out of the way to be helpful.  Love the coffee/wine bar in lobby.  Rooms are small, but that is all you need for NYC.  Very clean and pretty. Great neighborhood, and no traffic noise at night.

title: THE ABSOLUTELY BEST!
text:
I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY. The location is perfectly placed in the city and so easy to get to. We literally walked everywhere or took short Uber trips. 

 My friend and i had a girls weekend and chose the stay here, the best decision we could have made for lodging. The hotel is chic , super clean and modern. (The rooms are smaller but so is NY lol) THE STAFF ARE PHENOMENAL! My favorite part of my stay. They exceeded my expectations, so polite , warm and professional. Geo and Christina are amazing. But everyone is just the bomb.  5 stars for the staff along. BOOK THIS HOTEL!

title: How you imagine a boutique hotel but also warm & welcoming
text: This was a last-minute decision to travel (pandemic travel is only last minute). I can only say that the staff--those lovely people--made this hotel stand out from all the other cool, dark interior, hip boutique hotels. Christina who seemed to know everything was amazing & charming & her goal is always to make you feel warm & welcomed. The rooms are tiny--I mean there is no room to exercise & your neighbors are close (& some are loud) BUT the beds are super comfortable and the bathroom stocked with brand toiletries & excellent showers & frette bathrobes. The Chelsea location is perfect. The public spaces make this hotel. There's a rooftop deck and a lounge-like lobby with a coffee/wine bar and a large gathering table and two curving velvet couches. I met my friends in the lobby that last morning for coffee before I caught the Acela (10 blocks up 8th Ave) and they, born & bred New Yorkers both, kept asking how I found this charming place. Trust me--cosy, warm, welcoming with a dash of hip and personality plus! It's the people who make this place worth it.

title: The perfect hotel does exist!
text: Too many positive things to say about this place. I stay in NYC all the time and this hotel is just special. It's set in a cozy neighborhood in Chelsea, very close to the train and some great restaurants. The rooms are wonderful with an overall elevated design and style. The lobby coffee shop is very convenient and the rooftop has great wine, drinks and amazing views. I stayed for an extended amount of time and the staff became truly like friends - they were all so welcoming and helpful. The Moore is now a home away from home in Chelsea. Stay here!!

title: The Moore Hotel in Chelsea -a perfect spot!
text: We had an incredible time at the Moore Hotel in Chelsea!  It is such a beautifully designed hotel and the atmosphere was warm and friendly thanks to the staff and the special touches.   Our group had two rooms - a view queen and a corner queen.  Both rooms were sophisticated and impeccably clean (seriously, these rooms were so clean and well cared for!)   As is the case in most of NYC, the rooms are smallish  but these were both cleverly appointed with wardrobes, a full desk, and nicely sized bathrooms.  We had plenty of storage for four adults on a four day trip!  We didn't hear a peep from our neighbors at night and the beds were very comfortable.    The rooftop bar and the lobby were charming and so welcoming - we spent hours hanging out in both areas making our plans over  glasses of wine and delicious americanos.  Room service was easy with a  wonderful collaboration for food delivery that had great food.  We ordered a couple of times through their service and it was fast & easy.   Chelsea is a great neighborhood with plenty to see and easy access to all parts of Manhattan.   The clincher for us, and the reason we will definitely go back  is the staff - everyone was so friendly and the recommendations from the front of house team were fantastic. Every place they suggested was a win - from local spots right around the corner to across town.  They have a genuine love for the city that is infectious :)   Thank you for everything - we are already planning our next visit back to the Moore!

title: Best location, AMAZING staff, the comfiest beds, updated rooms. This hotel is perfect!
text:
If you’re looking to get around all of Manhattan, this hotel is in the absolute perfect spot. It was so convenient to get to and from the airport because it is right by the subway E train, (which also takes you all over Manhattan! We used it a bunch, we didn’t have to take a single taxi or Uber which saved us a ton of money) and the hotel was also right by the High Line, the path along the pier, and is a short walk to Times Square but far enough away where you get a neighborhood feel and not a tourist one. My boyfriend and I seriously were able to cover the entire island in 3 days thanks to the perfect location. We walked basically everywhere and took the train home in the evenings. It has a lot of nightlife within walking distance (Tao, PHD, Somewhere Nowhere, 1OAK, and more are all within 10 minute walking distance) but you didn’t get loud and drunk people nearby. Seriously can’t rave enough about the location.

The rooms are small but that’s what you get in New York… I don’t know why people would expect anything different. The rooms are super cute though!!! Updated with SUPER cozy beds and really fancy showers! The rooftop area and the little coffee shop downstairs is awesome to have to!

Lastly, everyone says New Yorkers are mean but the staff here totally proved that incorrect. Christina in particular was beyond helpful and an absolute riot—my boyfriend and I loved her! Seriously, they did everything to make you feel welcome and right at home. Good vibes all around. 

Everything about our stay was amazing. There’s no point in staying anywhere else because this hotel is perfect. Thank you guys for everything!!! 🤍🤍🤍

title: The Moore Hotel
text: Beautiful new boutique hotel in the heart of Chelsea and just a few minutes walk to the meatpacking district! Chic property with brand new rooms and a rooftop outdoor bar and lounge area. The staff is very friendly and accommodating which allows for a personalized experience. Will definitely come back!

title: Wonderful stay at The Moore! Chic, clean and convenient
text:
We had a wonderful stay of an overall of 4 nights. We started with 2 nights and continued booking an additional 2 nights. The hotel is very new and we are happy to have been part of their soft opening guests :) ! Beautiful interior down to the details. We stayed in a standard room with a view to the street which was very pleasant since one of us needed to work most of the day. Big desk, very comfortable workspace.

The staff was full of energy and so friendly and welcoming at all times. The hotel has a wonderful cafe/bar at the entrance which was super convenient (& the coffee and pastries are delicious!). There is a big & great rooftop open to all guests that you can drink your morning coffee from with a nice view of the city, work from or have some sunset drinks. 

Location is super convenient. Down the block you have the C & E subway (3 stops from SoHo); 10 minute walk from Chelsea market area; 10 minute walk to Highline; 15-20 minute walk to Flatiron. 

For those who plan to travel around the city with a Lime motor bike - this hotel is located in a green parking zone which is also very convenient! 

Overall, great stay and happy to have found a great spot to recommend to friends and family :)

title: Great Staff and Amenities
text: The hotel just went thru a thorough renovation. The lobby is gorgeous, the amenities are top notch and the generous bathrooms make up for the small rooms. Overall, it's a great place to base yourself in one of manhattan's more interesting neighborhoods.

title: A New Yorker's Review
text:
The Moore staff creates a second-to-none experience that is polished and comfortable, original and familiar, and relaxing and exhilarating. As an NYCer, I've toured boutique hotels around my city and can confidently say that The Moore delivers on service, aesthetic, location, and feel.
Stay here.

title: Don’t Miss The Moore in Chelsea
text: Took a chance on the Moore hotel that had just opened about a week before our arrival and had not accumulated any reviews yet. They were just putting the sign up outside when we arrived. It was a great decision. Located in a great part of Chelsea, equal distance to get down to the Village via the Highline or up to see a show.  The staff were fantastic. Everyone we encountered could not have been more friendly and willing to help in any way (shout out to Christina for her recommendations and enthusiasm). One caveat, the rooms are small; but who goes to NYC to hang out in their room. Great bed and great shower and don’t miss the rooftop space for decompressing from your city activities. Check out the Moore on your next NYC visit, you won’t regret it.

title: Great Hotel & Great Staff
text: I was in NYC on business and heard about the hotel from a colleague. He was right! Great space & great staff. I felt right at home. The staff was very accommodating & kind, always asking how my day was. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Home away from home
text: I regularly travel to NY and have finally found a hotel I love. My home away from home. The rooms are charming with a great vibe. Perfect for relaxing or working from home. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend staying here wether on vacation or a work trip. The location is perfect and I can’t wait to visit again.

title: Will definitely be coming back!
text: I loved staying here so much! Will definitely be coming back every time I am in New York! Perfect stay, clean, comfortable and gorgeous! The beds are so comfortable and the staff are lovely. I will recommend this place to family and friends in the future

title: perfect staycation
text: Me and my partner needed a break from the everyday routine and escaped to the Moore for a perfect weekend in the city. The staff the vibe the location ... everything was perfect! Will totally be back!

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Best staff I’ve encountered at a hotel. Amenities were awesome from a rooftop deck, bar/cafe in the lobby, and bikes to take right outside. Great rooms and high end appliances/soaps. Wonderful furniture inside. Picture perfect
